oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Voucher/Abstract of Purchases for January 1864
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Military commanders on occasion purchased on credit supplies from the local population. In this case an unidentified Union unit purchased 100 pound of flour at $0.49 per pound from Uriah Denton. The abstract was simply approved by the Colonel Commanding Brigade with no further identification. The abstract would be necessary documentation for Uriah Denton to collect the money owed him by the United States Army.
